result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather L Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather L Boyd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather L Boyd was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Heather L Boyd in court with attorney Todd W Bennett.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 Dismissed.  On Ct. 2 Court sentenced defendant to pay $516.00 fines/costs.  Submit DNA sample.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  No jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Court called 3:34 PM. Defendant Heather L Boyd appeared in person. Petition is reviewed. Court finds defendant indigent and appoints Atty Todd Bennett. Defendant to pay $50/mo starting 4-15-16. New court dates given by Judge as Pre-trial now April 4, 2016 at 2:00 PM and return on May 18, 2016 at 2:45 PM. Court adjourned 3:45 PM.
